noun.description: A type of undershirt or undertunic worn in ancient Rome.
In the Anglo-Saxon church: a tunic worn beneath the alb. rare.

origin: Late 17th century; earliest use found in Thomas Brown (bap. 1663, d. 1704), writer. From classical Latin subucula undertunic, in post-classical Latin also undertunic worn by a priest in the Old Testament (Vulgate) from sub- + -uere to put + -cula.
